holidays.name: National Deep Dish Pizza Day
holidays.description: A day to celebrate the cheesy, saucy, and oh-so-thick pizza style that originated in Chicago. Perfect excuse to indulge in a slice or two of this deliciously heavy pie!
holidays.origin: Started by pizza enthusiasts and food bloggers who wanted to honor Chicago‚Äôs signature deep-dish style pizza.
holidays.funFact: The deep dish pizza was invented in 1943 at Pizzeria Uno in Chicago, and the crust is so thick that you can actually eat it with a knife and fork!

holidays.name: Go For Broke Day
holidays.description: A tribute to the Japanese American soldiers in World War II who fought against incredible odds, showing courage and determination with the motto ‚ÄòGo For Broke.‚Äô
holidays.origin: Established to honor the 442nd Regimental Combat Team, the most decorated unit of its size and length of service in U.S. military history.
holidays.funFact: Despite facing discrimination at home, the 442nd became the most decorated American unit for its size and length of service during WWII.

holidays.name: Walk to Work Day
holidays.description: Encouraging people to leave the car behind and enjoy a brisk walk to work, promoting health, environmental consciousness, and a fresh start to the day.
holidays.origin: Started as an urban wellness initiative to reduce traffic congestion and improve physical fitness.
holidays.funFact: Walking to work burns an average of 300 calories and can boost your mood and creativity for the rest of the day!

holidays.name: Be Heard Day
holidays.description: A lively day dedicated to expressing yourself, speaking your mind, and making your voice count in all areas of life.
holidays.origin: Created by communicators and advocates to inspire confident expression and active listening worldwide.
holidays.funFact: Studies show that people who confidently communicate their ideas are 60% more likely to be promoted at work.
